metadata.title: CVE-2021-29265 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.7.usbip_sockfd_store in drivers/usb/usbip/stub_dev.c allows attackers tocause a denial of service (GPF) because the stub-up sequence has raceconditions during an update of the local and shared status, akaCID-9380afd6df70.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1114.127~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1060-fips - 4.4.0-1060.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.66').
